metadata.title: CVE-2023-52516 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:dma-debug: don't call __dma_entry_alloc_check_leak() underfree_entries_lock__dma_entry_alloc_check_leak() calls into printk -> serial consoleoutput (qcom geni) and grabs port->lock under free_entries_lockspin lock, which is a reverse locking dependency chain as qcom_geniIRQ handler can call into dma-debug code and grab free_entries_lockunder port->lock.Move __dma_entry_alloc_check_leak() call out of free_entries_lockscope so that we don't acquire serial console's port->lock under it.Trimmed-down lockdep splat: The existing dependency chain (in reverse order) is:               -> #2 (free_entries_lock){-.-.}-{2:2}:        _raw_spin_lock_irqsave+0x60/0x80        dma_entry_alloc+0x38/0x110
